article_title: The Affordable Care Act Meets The IRS, Chaos Ensues

article_metadata.author: Joe Harpaz

og.description: Monday, April 18, 2016 – ‘tax day’ in the U.S. – was meant to be a day of reckoning of sorts for the Affordable Care Act (ACA) and its controversial individual mandate. The date marks the individual tax filing deadline for the first tax year in which Applicable Large Employers (ALEs) with 50 or more full-time employees had to provide tax forms to the IRS proving that those employees had insurance.
